section.title: What will Jmol v10 look like?
section.p: Jmol has undergone a number of changes this year. Many of these changes were motivated by the goal of turning Jmol into a viable alternative for the Chime Plug-in. http://www.mdlchime.com
In the spring of 2003 the RasMol/Chime script compiler and interpreter were written. That code was introduced in Jmol v6.

Through the summer and winter of 2003 the graphics engine was completely rewritten to provide true 3D rendering capabilities. It is a software implementation designed and optimized for rendering molecules. It does not require any special hardware and will run on most popular browsers with Java support (including those with Java 1.1 JVMs).

These pages demonstrate the pre-release development version of the Jmol applet, combining simple examples of RasMol/Chime script commands with 3D rendering:
